template.html:
Welcome to the Über CMS installation process.

What Will Happen...

  1. Database and general settings.
  2. Installation process.
  3. Finish.

Continue to general settings...

Advanced Users

Custom Install

To create a custom installation e.g. install your own plugins as apart of the process, you can modify the file located in \App_Code\InstallScript.cs or add your own class within the namespace UberCMS.Installer and create a method with the following header as an invocation point:

public static void install(Connector conn)

The object Connector will require you to add using UberLib.Connector to the top of your class in the imports/using section.

Automatic Install

To automatically install an Über CMS installation, simply create the file CMS.config in the root of Über CMS. Then add the following text:

<settings>
<db>
<host>hostname of MySQL server</host>
<port>port of MySQL server</port>
<database>the database for uber cms</database>
<username>MySQL username</username>
<password>associated password for the user</password>
</db>
<mail>
<host>host name of mail server</host>
<port>port of mail server</port>
<username>username of an email account</username>
<password>password of the associated email account</password>
<address>the full address of the associated email account</address>
</mail>
</settings>

Optionally you can leave the inside of mail empty (<mail></mail> to disable the built-in e-mail queue. Then you just need to visit the following URL to run the installation script:

/install/install

For example:

http://localhost/install/install
